doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 61 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 172[Air Date: 11/27/1985]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 61 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 172[Air Date: 11/27/1985]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. New AIDS guidelines counteract hysteria2. United States Supreme Court reviews sodomy statutes3. Gay Anti-Defamation League holds first meeting in New York City, includes clip of Vito Russo speech4. What the Gay Cable Network is thankful for5. Drug Abuse Resistance Education funds Independent AIDS researchers6. Carol Burnett speaks out in public announcements, American Foundation for AIDS Research7. New York City Council Health Committee hearing coverage, David Rothenberg speaks8. FBI and Rock Hudson9. Richard Feldman, Attorney discusses lack of gay rights and housing in the New York City areaCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp10. Sports, including Bart Conner clip11. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Lori Behrman, Director of Public Information for GMHC, discusses media and presentation12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. John Burke, footage of Sybil Bruncheon and Bill Baumer at Halloween parade, Christopher StreetCOMMERCIAL: The Monster2. Eye on New YorkCOMMERCIAL: AIDS hotline, New York AIDS Action3. "Sounds in the Distance," includes clips
